revision.text:
Super-hackathon "standards and ontologies for Systems Biology" The Okinawa super hackathon aims to gather developers of the various standard formats and ontologies used in the field of Systems Biology, in order to improve their interfacing. The event will be held from '''January 28''' through '''February 2''' at the [http://www.oist.jp/ Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology], Japan. It combines both the fifth SBGN meeting and the 3rd annual [http://biomodels.net BioModels.net] meeting. The fifth SBGN meeting will be a “Spec-a-thon” devoted to finalise SBGN Level 1, and a hackathon, where we will develop software support for the language. The third annual [http://biomodels.net/ BioModels.net] meeting should feature presentations about progresses of the core projects and related efforts. We will also work on the interactions of [http://www.sbgn.org SBGN] and [http://biomodels.net BioModels.net] efforts with other formats such as [http://www.biopax.org BioPAX] and [http://sbml.org SBML]. [[image: Sbgn3.5-oist-150.jpg | right]] The workshop co-organizers are: * Hiroaki Kitano ([http://www.sbi.jp/ SBI] & [http://www.sonycsl.co.jp/ Sony CSL]) * Nicolas Le Novère ([http://www.ebi.ac.uk EMBL-EBI]) * Mike Hucka ([http://www.cds.caltech.edu Caltech CDS]) * Akira Funahashi ([http://www.sbi.jp SBI] & [http://www.bio.keio.ac.jp/ Keio University]) We gratefully acknowledge generous funding from the following agencies: * [http://www.oist.jp Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology] * [http://www.nedo.go.jp/english New Energy and Industrial Technology Development Organization (NEDO)] * [http://www.sbi.jp The Systems Biology Institute] ==Photo Album==


Click here to go to the photo album from the meeting.
==Agenda, Presentations & Video Recordings==
For the first time, we are video-recording talks and discussions and will post files online as each session progresses. The files are included in the table below. Beware that they are quite large (150 MB–1 GB each). They are [http://www.apple.com/quicktime/ QuickTime] movie files. Free players are available for Mac and Windows. Suggested approach for using the recordings: for talks that involved slide presentations, open both the video and the copy of the slides at the same time on your computer, so that you can follow along in the presentation during the talk. (Note: The volume and quality are low on the first day's recordings but is improved on the subsequent days. Thankfully, voices are generally clear, but you may need to ''really'' turn up the volume on your speakers or use earphones.)

Drinks self-pay (all-you-can-drink 1800JPY).'' |- |19:45- | colspan="4" | ''Shuttle back to the hotel'' |- |} Day 6 (Saturday, 2 February 2008) {| border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" class="whitetable" width="100%" ! width="75px" |Time !Event |- |Morning |Hacking |- |12:00 |''Lunch'' |- |Afternoon |Hacking |- |18:30 |''Shuttle to restaurant'' |- |19:00 |''Dinner: Japanese restaurant [http://www.anamanza.co.jp/restaurant/unkai.html "Utaki"] at Manza Beach Hotel 1F |- |21:30 |''Return shuttle service'' |} ==Supplementary Materials==
* [http://sbgn.cvs.sourceforge.net/*checkout*/sbgn/documents/specifications/Level1/sbgn-level1.pdf SBGN Level 1 specification draft (PDF)] of 2008-01-25 * [http://sbgn.cvs.sourceforge.net/*checkout*/sbgn/documents/meetings/SuperHackathon2008/CommentsTomFreeman.pdf Comments by Tom Freeman (Edinburgh group)] submitted to sbgn-discuss list some time ago and reexamined during the workshop * [[media:sbgn3.5-SourceSinkKitanoProposal.pdf | Source/Sink notation proposal from Hiroaki Kitano]] (from day 1 morning discussion about SBGN notation) * [[Events/SBGN_3.5/Discussion Notes:FinaliseL1Spec | Stuart's notes about day 1 discussions on remaining SBGN issues]] * [[media:Sbgn3.5-video-memory-chip-labels.jpg | Example of real-life video memory module with many connections]] from Hiroaki, apropos discussions about tags on modules * [[media:sbgn3.5-Kitano-ActivityFlow.pdf | Activity flow diagrams]] proposed by Hiroaki * Examples from PANTHER Pathway by Huaiyu Mi, to illustrate the problems discussed on 2008-01-27. [[media:Sbgn3.5-Synaptic_vesicle_trafficking.png | Example 1: Synaptic_vesicle_trafficking.png]] and [[media:Sbgn3.5-p38_MAPK_pathway.png | Example 2: p38_MAPK_pathway.png]] * [[Events/SBGN 3.5/Issues | SBGN Issues that were discussed and resolved]] * Examples of PANTHER diagrams relevant to gene regulation, by Huaiyu Mi: ** [[media:Sbgn3.5-RNApolymeraseI.png | General transcription RNA polymerase I.png]] ** [[media:Sbgn3.5-regulation.png | General transcription regulation.png]] ** [[media:Sbgn3.5-regulation-by-bZIP.png | Transcription regulation by bZIP.png]] ** [[media:Sbgn3.5-mRNA-splicing.png | mRNA splicing.png]] * Example by Christian Knuepfer about why non-overlapping rules for labels don't really solve the problem: [[media:Sbgn3.5-label-problem.pdf | label-problem.pdf]] * [[MIASE | MIASE work page]] * [[Events/SBGN 3.5/Resolutions | Changes agreed to SBGN Process Notation by the end of the meeting]]
==Fun Quotes==
Overheard at this meeting: ;-) * ''”I have a very good understanding of the misunderstanding.”'' – Emek Demir * ''”I don't like dangling things.”'' – Nicolas Le Novère * ''”You are obsessed by dots!”'' – Nicolas Le Novère * ''”My semantic alarms are going off at the moment.”'' – Emek Demir * ''”I'm not sure if it's apathy, tardiness or conversion.”'' – Stuart Moodie * ''”It hardly seems credible, but I think we are actually in agreement.”'' – Stuart Moodie * ''”Can I raise a concern that will never happen but I will raise it anyway?”'' – Emek Demir * ''”If you don’t care, you don’t care, here we are talking about the case you care.”'' – Nicolas Le Novère * ''”I think '''that''' was a remarkable amount of agreement.”'' – Mike Hucka

NetBuilder] |- |} ==Logistical Information==
===Venue=== The meeting will be held at the [http://www.oist.jp/seasidehouse.html seaside house] of the [http://www.oist.jp/ Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology]. ===Accommodations=== Accommodation will be arranged by OIST/local organiser for all the participants. We are planning to stay in the following hotel (not confirmed yet as of Dec 15) * Rizzan Sea-Park Hotel at Tancha-bay [http://www.rizzan.co.jp http://www.rizzan.co.jp] tel:+81-(0)98-964-6611 * [http://www.oist.jp/seasidehouse.html Seaside house] Tel:+81-(0)98-966-8711 Transportation between the hotel and the venue: Shuttle service will be available during the following period: 8:30-8:45 and 19:30-20:30 ===Travel Information=== Transportation between Naha airport and your hotels will be arranged. (About an hour drive to the hotel/venue from the airport.) On your arrival at the airport, look for the person with “OIST Super Hackathon Workshop” sign. General Info on Okinawa: [http://www.ocvb.or.jp/index.php?current=General_Page&action=Top_Page&mode=isel&lang=en Okinawa Tourist Information]
